biotools.summary: xSyn is a software tool for identifying such 3-way interactions that 2 genes’ expression levels are clustered in different space locations under the control of a third gene’s expression levels. It uses cancer gene expression data based on an optimization procedure involving the usage of UPGMA (Unweighted Pair Group Method with Arithmetic Mean) and synergy.

bioschemas.name: xSyn
